Yesterday, in responding to a question... SAN FRANCISCO( Reuters)- Chrysler Group LLC's chief executive apologized on Saturday for describing the high-interest bailout loans extended by the U.S. and Canadian governments in 2009 as "shyster loans. "Yesterday, in responding to a question about Chrysler's government loans, I used a term in reference to the interest rate being charged on our government loans that has raised concern," CEO Sergio Marchionne

Mike Pence of Indiana and Greg Walden of Oregon unveiled this week the Broadcaster Freedom Act, which would ban the FCC from forcing broadcasters to give free airtime to opposing sides on controversial issues. The American people cherish freedom, especially freedom of speech and of the press, said Mike Pence , a former radio talk show host who introduced the same bill in the last session of Congress when Democrats still controlled the House.
